dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5719 IH: To provide for interim appropriations for the National Capital Planning Commission and the Commission of Fine Arts with respect to any fiscal year for which appropriations are not otherwise provided for the commissions.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Norton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Appropriations

form.official-title: To provide for interim appropriations for the National Capital Planning Commission and the Commission of Fine Arts with respect to any fiscal year for which appropriations are not otherwise provided for the commissions.

section.header: Interim appropriations for the National Capital Planning Commission and the Commission of Fine Arts

subsection.text: If during a fiscal year (beginning with fiscal year 2025) there is an appropriation for the expenses of an entity described in subsection (b), and during the next fiscal year there is no appropriation for such expenses, there shall be appropriated for such next fiscal year, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, such sums as are necessary for the expenses of the entity, at a rate for operations and under the terms and conditions provided in the previous fiscal year.
The entities described in this subsection are as follows:

subsection.header: Effect of enactment of subsequent appropriations
subsection.text: If an appropriation for the expenses of an entity described in subsection (b), or a general appropriation bill providing appropriations for the Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies without provision for such expenses, is enacted into law on any date during a fiscal year following the expenditure of funds during such fiscal year pursuant to this Actâ€”

paragraph.text: such expenditure shall be charged to such appropriation (if any); and
appropriations made available pursuant to this Act shall not be available after the date of the enactment of such appropriation or general appropriation bill.
